spec.name: Lynx Cinema
spec.description: Lynx Cinema (Cin√©ma Lynx) is a historical movie theater in Casablanca, completed in 1950 and designed by architect **Dominique Basciano**. The cinema's design reflects the sleek, functional **Modernist** style of the post-war era, characteristic of major commercial architecture in Casablanca at the time. It played a role in the city's mid-century cultural life but is now **closed**, standing as an example of the city's declining single-screen cinema heritage.
